name: Ramada Ulaanbaatar Citycenter

reviews.text: It's brand new and clean, which is a big step up from the UB Hotel or Bayangol where I've also stayed. The room is modern-looking, sheets clean, beds comfy and the free wi-fi was great. Didn't have any trouble with the TV and there were indeed a lot of channels to choose from. Staff is friendly and responsive. The breakfast buffet was fine and the dining room has a nice view. That said, there are some shortcomings and I'm not sure I would stay again. There are design flaws as others have pointed out and a lot of cheap shortcuts in the construction. The shower head was super high, about right for someone over 6' tall, bathtub also very high, sink rather low, the faucet loose and leaking, part of the wallpaper in the room peeling, the Toto type toilet was not working (flushed fine but just not the extra features) and the electrical cord for the toilet was strung across the button to flush the toilet. The location is fairly convenient but it's 20-25 min walk to Sukhbaatar square and traffic, of course, is often terrible. There was a wedding going on the weekend we stayed there and it seemed many of the guests were staying on our floor which meant very drunk guests carousing in the hallway at all hours. I called the front desk twice and the noise stopped sometime after, but you should probably try to request a room on a floor without any wedding guests.
reviews.title: New and clean

reviews.text: I stayed at the Ramada for three nights in October 2011. Overall I think it is a very good hotel and that the staff are excellent. However, the hotel is new and I get the impression that many staff are new to the hotel business. As a result you should be prepared for things not going smoothly. I had a number of problems, most of which were fixed by the staff, but they wasted a lot of my time. For example:
reviews.title: Could be a great hotel, but not there yet

reviews.text: 1. My room was extremely hot and the radiators could not be turned down or off. I could not open the window to get any cool air so asked the front desk for help. They explained that the heating system had recently been turned on and that it was impossible to change the temperature in the room. A member of staff managed to open my window but the noise and fumes from the adjacent road were terrible so I asked to change room.
reviews.title: New Hotel,not operating yet properly.

reviews.text: 2. In my original room the WiFi internet did not work despite following the hotel instructions and getting help from a member of staff. I had to use the cable option instead. In my second room I couldn't access the Internet via cable but the WiFi connection was great.
reviews.title: Good new hotel

reviews.text: 3. In both rooms I had problems with the TV. The hotel has a very complicated Internet TV system with a huge number of channels, but the user must press a sequence of buttons on both the TV and set-top box to turn the TV on. In my first room the set top box was in a strange position so that the only way to use the remote control was to walk up to the side of the TV (this defeats the object of the remote). In the second room it took several visits by hotel staff to get the TV working (the HDMI cable was missing).
reviews.title: Best hotel in Ulaanbaatar

reviews.text: One of the newest hotel. Rooms are good, with bathroom wall transparent in to the room. No cabinet for cloths. Excellent choice of TV programs in different languages and available internet in all rooms with no extra cost. Restaurant at 5th floor is good with very supportive manager. Good choices of fresh juices and cakes are served at the same. Elevators are slow, and only one is going to top floor restaurant, which require waiting for around 5 min or more. Breakfast could be improved with more variety of food have to be included, especially fresh vegetables and different bread types. As part of the hotel there is small shopping center and very good supermarket. Hotel is very much occupied with guests and you may need reservation in advance. Swimming pool is not available. For its price value it could be highly recommended.
reviews.title: Hotel to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for one night during our honeymoon, after a week staying 90km's away in a yurt in the beautiful mongolian countryside. We boarded a train to Beijing early the next morning so it was wonderful to have a good, clean and pleasant hotel to stay in. The rooms were quiet, clean and the shower was excellent. The free wifi was great.
reviews.title: Good hotel, nice rooms, lovely after a week in the Mongolian countryside!

reviews.text: It was about 15 minutes walk to the main square, which was fine when we were there as the weather was fine. The highlight for us at this hotel was the rooftop bar where we saw a stunning sunset over Ulaanbaatar - you would pay a lot to go to a rooftop bar with that sort of view elsewhere in the world!! There is plenty of ourside seating and was nice inside as well. We enjoyed a few drinks and a lovely meal in the hotel restaurant.
reviews.title: Outstanding...for UB City

reviews.text: Overall, this hotel seemed to be one of the best in the city and suited our needs perfectly. Would recommend.
reviews.title: Overall a good choice

reviews.text: Ramada is the best option for Ulaanbaatar in a city that doesn't have many options for international travelers. Excellent staff. Room (King Deluxe) was spacious though desk space is cramped next to bed. Wi-fi very reliable. HD TV with int'l channels. Housekeeping excellent. Dry cleaning - same day if sent before 11 a.m. JOT Restaurant - great breakfast buffet and free. Elevators quirky and small. Max Mall (next door) and State Dept. Store (easy 15 min walk). Only drawback - not close to Sukhbaatar Square if your business is there. Stayed 15 days and enjoyed it. Taxi to aiport $25. Hotel limo is $80.
reviews.title: One of UB's better hotels

reviews.text: Have stayed in a few UB hotels and this is the best so far. By no means wonderful in comparison to other great capital cities but still good, great staff and comfy beds. Must say the food is a wee bit hit or miss. Breakfast nothing spectacular. The hotel is reasonably peaceful in a hectic part of the city.

I stayed here for two days while in Mongolia for work. The room was very nice and modern though the rest of the hotel was not as nice as I had expected since I had been told that the Ramada is the best hotel in Ulan Baatar. The restaurant was average but the bar on the top floor was great. Good drinks and ambiance. The hotel is a bit outside of the downtown area even though it is called citycenter and because of heavy traffic took 15-20 minutes by cab to get to the center of the city where most of my meetings were held. Overall a good choice for Mongolia but if you set expectations too high you may be disappointed. The service was very good and I rented cars from them each day and the drivers were always available, prompt, and professional.
reviews.title: Good quality for Mongolia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was our first time coming to Mongolia. It was totally different with whr we come from and we felt out of tank for the first time arriving. No tour guide, not much money, we made a budget tour ourself but at least, we extremely luckily got such a pleasure stay at Ramada Ulaanbaatar - a place took our heart away when we had to leave Mongolia. It located in such an amazing area that not convenient for you to shopping, having sight seeing but safe as well. The hotel is decorated simply modern but the staff make it extraordinary. They bring the sincere warmness thru their smiles, helpful services and always pay attention on wat we need. The facilities are not too grand or luxury, but they are just new, up to date and comfort your whole stay at a cold country like Mongolia. Value for money, great for holidays, warm for a cold country:) and excellent service from staff...Ramada hotel is simple but simply perfect for a holiday! Thanks a lot for make it our great holidays again!
reviews.title: A place that you do not only stay, you feel you belong

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After dismal reviews of most of the hotels in UB, we were amazed by the quality of this hotel. The room was super modern and very comfortable. There are still some issues here and there (i.e. hot water was "officially" unavailable in the hotel because of neighborhood shut-offs, but somehow we managed to still get hot water; the front staff did not complete the check-out we requested the night before because we were leaving early in the morning the next day), but I think this hotel will succeed as one of the more pleasant hotel options in the city. We stayed there near the end of August, and only the bar/lounge on the top floor was not yet completed.
reviews.title: A surprising gem

reviews.text: Ramada is a newly opened hotel, just one month ago or so, and I think that there's still space for improvement. The hotel is good, everything is new, the room is very comfortable and internet in the room is working well, provided by a modem in every room. Breakfast is OK, but I found few fruit and no bakery except toasted bread. Personnel is still making experience and sometimes they prepare many tables with two knives of different shape instead of knife and fork, but personnel is kind and helpful. Some construction defects are visible: the shower is without stand for soap and shampoo, so you don't know where to put these items. And in the corridor there is not signage for the fire exit, and the stairs are totally dark at night. Quite dangerous. I couldn't try the bar at the 17th floor, because it was due to open the day I left. In any case, there's also a bar at the lobby, but not serving spirits, with a good espresso machine and original Italian coffee. At the 3rd. floor there's a gym, with good machines, obviously all new, and a SPA which I didn't try. The hotel is in the same building and door-to-door with a new shopping mall, also recently opened, with many shops where it's possible to buy Mongolian cachemire, handicrafts, and there's also a small supermarket at the top floor. In general it's a good accomodation.
reviews.title: Good accomodation in the city center

description: Whether you are traveling for business or pleasure, make Ramada Ulaanbaatar Citycenter hotel , your home base in Mongolia. Located in the heart of the city, this upscale 4 star international hotel with 126 spacious and exquisitely designed guestrooms are only steps from anywhere you desire. Update friends and family on your trip with High-speed complimentary Wi-Fi internet access, and breakfast 'Excellence Award of 2012' from TripAdvisor.
